title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in India 2024
yAxis: GDP growth rate compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth rate compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2016.
But, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2023 to 2021.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2021 to 2019.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2024 to 2023.
gold: The statistic shows the growth of the real gross domestic product ( GDP ) in India from 2014 to 2018 , with projections up until 2024 . GDP refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year . It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country .
